HL7v2xStaticDef.EventDesc: ZPT/ACK - Transfer and Report of Patient Health Record

Component.Name: universal ID
Component.Predicate: If the first component for the HD data type is present, the second and third components are optional. If the third component is present, then the second must also be present (although in this case the first is optional). The second and third components must either both be valued (both non-null), or both be not valued (both null). This means that if all three components of the HD are valued, the entity identified by the first component is the same as the entity identified by components two and three taken together. However, implementers may choose, by site agreement, to specify that if all three components of the HD are valued, the first component defines a member in the set defined by the second and third components.

Component.Name: second and further given names or initials thereof
second and further given names or initials thereof
second and further given names or initials thereof

Field.Name: Patient Address
Field.ImpNote: PID.11 Patient Address Definition: This field contains the mailing address of the patient. In Malawi, patient usually only have an approximate location for their physical address. However, the village name, traditional authority (TA) and district are the important information using to identify patient's location. Thus we modified the arrangement and definitions of component in PID.11. The modified components are as below: Components: <Street Address (SAD)> ^ <Village Name (ST)> ^ <Traditional Authority Name (ST)> ^ <District Name (ST)> ^ <Zip or Postal Code (ST)> ^ <Country (ID)> ^ <Address Type (ID)> ^ <Other Geographic Designation (ST)> ^ <County/Parish Code (IS)> ^ <Census Tract (IS)> ^ <Address Representation Code (ID)> ^ <Address Validity Range (DR)> ^ <Effective Date (TS)> ^ <Expiration Date (TS)> The XAD.1, XAD.2, XAD.3 and XAD.4 are the only used components in PID.11 in Malawi.

If the third component is present, then the second must also be present (although in this case the first is optional). The second and third components must either both be valued (both non-null), or both be not valued (both null). This means that if all three components of the HD are valued, the entity identified by the first component is the same as the entity identified by components two and three taken together. However, implementers may choose, by site agreement, to specify that if all three components of the HD are valued, the first component defines a member in the set defined by the second and third components.

This means that if all three components of the HD are valued, the entity identified by the first component is the same as the entity identified by components two and three taken together. However, implementers may choose, by site agreement, to specify that if all three components of the HD are valued, the first component defines a member in the set defined by the second and third components.

Component.Name: name validity range

Segment.Name: ORC
Segment.ImpNote: Note: The value in ORC.1 field is used to indicate the semantics of the order segment. For ART messaging, the only value used is "RE" which indicates that information about an order is being passed (as opposed to actually asking for performance of the order). Definition of 'RE': The observations-to- follow code is used to transmit patient- specific information with an order. An order detail segment (e.g., OBR) can be followed by one or more observation segments (OBX). Any observation that can be transmitted in an ORU message can be transmitted with this mechanism. When results are transmitted with an order, the results should immediately follow the order or orders that they support.

Field.Name: Dispense Sub-ID Counter
Field.ImpNote: RXD.1 Dispense Sub-ID Counter Definition/Usage: This field starts with 1 the first time that medication/treatment is delivered/dispensed for this order. Increments by one with each additional issuance. This field is required by the HL7 Specification, however receivers implementing ART messaging are not expected to make use of it.

Field.Name: Dispense/Give Code
Field.ImpNote: RXD.2 Dispense/Give Code Definition/Usage: This field identifies the medical substance or treatment ordered to be given to the patient; it is equivalent to OBR-4-Universal Service ID.

Field.Name: Date/Time Dispensed
Field.ImpNote: RXD.3 Dispensed Date/Time Definition/Usage: This field identifies date and time in which the drug was dispensed. This is a required field per HL7, but it is not directly collected for ART messaging. Instead the date of the visit is defaulted in.

Field.Name: Actual Dispense Amount
Field.ImpNote: RXD.4 Actual Dispense Amount Definition/Usage: This field indicates the amount dispensed.

Field.Name: Actual Dispense Units
Field.ImpNote: RXD.5 Actual Dispense Units Definition/Usage: This field indicates the units dispensed. Site-defined table. This field is required if the units are not implied by the actual dispense code. If present, it overrides units implied by the actual dispense code.

Field.Name: Prescription Number
Field.ImpNote: RXD.7 Prescription Number Definition/Usage: This field is equivalent in uniqueness to the pharmacy/treatment supplier filler order number. At some sites, this may be the pharmacy/treatment supplier (internal) sequential form. At other sites, this may be an external number. This is a required field per HL7, for ART messaging xxxx.

Component.Name: second and further given names or initials thereof
source table
Component.Predicate: Used to delineate the first component.

SubComponent.Name: universal ID
SubComponent.Predicate: If the first component for the HD data type is present, the second and third components are optional. If the third component is present, then the second must also be present (although in this case the first is optional). The second and third components must either both be valued (both non-null), or both be not valued (both null). This means that if all three components of the HD are valued, the entity identified by the first component is the same as the entity identified by components two and three taken together. However, implementers may choose, by site agreement, to specify that if all three components of the HD are valued, the first component defines a member in the set defined by the second and third components.

Component.Name: check digit scheme
Component.Predicate: Contains the code identifying the check digit scheme employed.

Component.Name: name validity range
Component.ImpNote: This component cannot be fully expressed. Identified as v 2.4 erratum. Retained for backwards compatibility only as of v 2.5. Refer to Effective Date and Expiration Date components.

Field.Name: Total Daily Dose
Field.ImpNote: RXD.12 Total Daily Dose Definition/Usage: This field contains the total daily dose being dispensed as expressed in terms of the actual dispense units.
